#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Authorities blockade Chinese town rebelling over land dispute
#Text=Thursday , December 15 , 2011
#Text=Villagers in the Chinese town of Wukan are now in open revolt as , in the fourth month of their land dispute with the government , they expelled all Communist Party officials .
#Text=Last Sunday they also repelled an attempt by around a thousand police to retake the town using tear gas and water cannons .
#Text=Logo of Country Garden ( Holdings ) Ltd. , who bought Wukan land in an allegedly illegal sale by local officials .
#Text=Negotiations were previously ongoing over the land dispute with villagers claiming farmland was taken , and sold to private developers Country Garden , with no compensation provided to locals .
#Text=However , recent remarks over the legality of the initial protests in September by a county-level spokesperson prompted a return to street protests last week in the Guangdong province town .
#Text=Mass-protests on economic grounds are frequent in China .
#Text=An average of around 15,000 protests occur each month .
#Text=Local officials are frequently accused of requisitioning land , using police and thugs to intimidate rural farmers and complete — often illegal — evictions .
#Text=Following this , and as seems the case in Wukan , the land is sold on to local developers and entrepreneurs with no compensation paid to the evicted .
#Text=When rioting began this September in Wukan , State news agency Xinhua said that eleven investigations into forced evictions which had led to violent protests were underway .
#Text=A total of 31 local officials were facing potential criminal charges , with the reported cases of land grabs a mix of " illegal " and " badly executed " evictions .
#Text=In at least one case , a forced eviction resulted in the death of a 48-year-old woman .

#Text=Following on from the days of rioting over the land-grab in September , and the police 's ruthless retaking of the town of 20,000 , Lufeng county government officials — in an exceptional move — commenced negotiations with representatives chosen by the villagers themselves .
#Text=Until , that is , last week after a local official asserted the town 's chosen negotiators were helping " overseas forces that want to sow divisions between the government and villagers .

#Text= According to relevant law , regulations and policies , search results for Wukan cannot be displayed " when a search for the town 's name is made .

column1: #Text=It is being suggested that Chinese web users have switched to using the tag " WK " , which can be taken as an abbreviation of either " Wukan " or " What is going on ?
